title: Apigee - Discover APIs using APIs list

# Apigee - Discover APIs using APIs list
**    Preview    — Apigee API hub ** This feature is subject to the "Pre-GA Offerings Terms" in the General Service Terms section   of the [Service Specific Terms](/terms/service-terms#1) .     Pre-GA features are available "as is" and might have limited support.    For more information, see the [launch stage descriptions](/products#product-launch-stages) .
The **APIs** list is the default page for API hub. It  displays a subset of information about all APIs in API hub. The first  time you view this page, there are no APIs listed. You must [Register](/apigee/docs/api-hub/register-apis) or [import](#import) any APIs that you want to manage using API hub.
- **Organization name:** Define this displayed name in [Settings, Display](/apigee/docs/api-hub/customize-display) .
- **Search box:** Refine the APIs list view by typing [search](#search) terms here.
- **Filter list:** Refine the APIs list view by selecting [filter](#filter) items.
- **Register API:** [  Enter information about APIs](/apigee/docs/api-hub/register-apis) so they appear in the APIs list.
- **API name:** A list of registered APIs. Click the column head to sort.
- **Lifecycle stage:** Define the **Lifecycle** stages in [Settings, Lifecycle stages](/apigee/docs/api-hub/lifecycle-stages) .   Select the **Lifecycle** stage when you [register](/apigee/docs/api-hub/register-apis#register-an-api) or [edit](/apigee/docs/api-hub/register-apis#edit-api-registration-details) an   API.
- **Business unit:** Define the **Business unit** in [Settings, Taxonomies](/apigee/docs/api-hub/taxonomies#system-taxonomies) .   Select the **Business unit** when you register or edit an API.
- **Team:** Define the **Team** in [   Settings, Taxonomies](/apigee/docs/api-hub/taxonomies#system-taxonomies) . Select the **Team** when you register or edit an API.
- **Documentation:** Select the primary [architectural style](/apigee/docs/api-hub/register-apis#arch-style) of the   API and upload a [  description document](/apigee/docs/api-hub/register-apis#descr-doc) when you register or edit an API. This button appears only   if the API has a recommended [deployment](/apigee/docs/api-hub/deployments) set,   and that deployment has a [version](/apigee/docs/api-hub/versions) assigned.
To [view details about an API](/apigee/docs/api-hub/explore-overview) , click an  API row.
Refine the list of APIs displayed using one of the following options:
- [Filter](#filter) 
- [Pagination](#pagination) 
- [Search](#search) 
- [Sort](#sort)

## Filter
**Note:** The filter options available are configured by a user with [administrator permissions](/apigee/docs/api-hub/permissions#roles) . For more information, see [Manage taxonomies](/apigee/docs/api-hub/taxonomies) and [Manage lifecycle stages](/apigee/docs/api-hub/lifecycle-stages) .
To specify filter options:
- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- Click **Filter** . The **Filter** pane opens.
- Specify or select filter options from the following:- **Match type:** Select to display APIs that **Match all** or **Match any** of the selected filters.
- **Lifecycle stages:** The progressive phase of development of the API
- **Target users:** The intended users (consumers) of an API
- **Style:** The primary architectural style of the API
- **Team:** The producing team responsible for an API
- **Business unit:** The business unit responsible for an API
- **Note:** There may be additional [custom options](/apigee/docs/api-hub/taxonomies#custom-taxonomies) .    For more information on predefined taxonomies, see [Manage taxonomies](/apigee/docs/api-hub/taxonomies) .
- Clicklast_page **Toggle panel** to close the **Filter** pane.
- The selected filter properties display the conditional   logic (AND or OR) that the filter query is using as shown in the following example.
- To clear an individual filter, click the **X** on the filter.   To clear all filters, click **Clear all** in the **Filter** pane.## Pagination
When there are multiple APIs, they are displayed across multiple pages.
To navigate between pages:
- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From the **APIs** list, locate the pagination tools   as shown below:
- Select the number of APIs to display per page.
- Click **> Forward ** to go to the next page.
- Click ** < Back ** to go to the previous page.## Search
Refine the list of APIs displayed to just the APIs that contain a specific search term. The term  can be in the API name or API description text.
To search for APIs containing a specific term:
- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- Type a term in the search box. The list of APIs is updated to display only the APIs that   contain the specified term.
- To clear the search text box, clickclose **Clear** .## Sort
To reorder the list of APIs displayed:
- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From the **APIs** list page, locate the **API name** column heading.
- The arrow indicates the current sort priority.   Aarrow_downwarddown arrow indicates descending order.   Anarrow_upwardup arrow indicates ascending order.
- Click **API name** to sort the APIs list by name.## What's next?
